author: Gary Hilson
description:
As artificial intelligence pushes data center processing and networking capacities to their limits, optical interconnects are stepping up to keep pace to enable AI scale-up and scale-out networks. Broadcom Inc. recently announced its third-generation 200G/lane co-packaged optics (CPO) product line, which builds on CPO technology it has been focused on since 2021 with its first-generation […]

The post AI Clusters Spur Optical Connectivity appeared first on EE Times.
title: AI Clusters Spur Optical Connectivity

author: Alan Patterson
description:
Rapidus and EDA vendor Siemens have allied in support of the new Japanese foundry’s aim for 2-nm wafer production by 2027. Rapidus is building alliances with ecosystem partners such as IBM and AI chip designer Tenstorrent. IBM, the world’s first company to make 2-nm chips on a pilot line in New York State, is transferring […]

The post Rapidus, Siemens Join 2-nm Alliance Targeting 2027 Production appeared first on EE Times.
title: Rapidus, Siemens Join 2-nm Alliance Targeting 2027 Production

author: Curt Hillier, technical director of automotive solutions, and Razvan Ionescu, automotive software and tools architect, NXP Semiconductors
description:
The rise of the software-defined vehicle (SDV) is transforming the automotive industry. Where mechanical engineering once reigned supreme, the future belongs to software. Code defines functionality and evolves with the vehicle, and the owner can enjoy new experiences long after their car has left the factory. The high-performance computing platforms found in modern vehicles are […]

The post Why the Cloud Is Essential for SDV Development appeared first on EE Times.
title: Why the Cloud Is Essential for SDV Development
